title: Voting - ErgoDocs
summary: Votes on foundational changes, such as block version, span 32 epochs and demand a 90% miner consensus. Everyday changes, like block size adjustments, require only a simple majority. Each block allows miners to cast votes for up to two everyday changes and one foundational change. These votes are included in the block's header. To vote "Yes" for a change at the beginning of an epoch, a miner places the change's identifier directly into the block header.

sections.heading: Voting Cycles and Types of Changes#
sections.content: Votes on foundational changes, such as block version, span 32 epochs and demand a 90% miner consensus. Everyday changes, like block size adjustments, require only a simple majority. Each block allows miners to cast votes for up to two everyday changes and one foundational change. These votes are included in the block's header.

sections.heading: Affirmative Votes#
sections.content: To vote "Yes" for a change at the beginning of an epoch, a miner places the change's identifier directly into the block header.

sections.heading: Negative or Neutral Votes#
sections.content: To vote "No" or abstain, a miner enters a zero value in place of the identifier byte in the block header.

sections.heading: System Constants#
sections.content:
Epoch length for voting: 1024 blocks
Epochs needed for foundational change: 32
Epochs before activating approved foundational change: 128

sections.heading: Current Network Settings#
sections.content:
Maximum block size: 1271009 bytes
Maximum box size: 4096 bytes
Maximum transaction size: 96kb

sections.heading: Parameters Table#
sections.content:
The following table describes vote identifiers, default values (during launch), possible steps, and minimum and maximum values.
If the step is not defined in the table, its value is defined as \(\max(\lfloor current\_value / 100 \rfloor, 1)\). 
If the minimum value for a parameter is not defined, it equals zero. 
If the maximum value is not defined, it equals 1,073,741,823.
A miner includes a parameter identifier (\(id\)) into the block header to propose or vote for increasing a parameter.
If the miner supports decreasing the parameter, they would include (\(-id\)) into the block header.

Parameter values are to be written into the extension section on the first block of a voting epoch, that is, in the extension of a block when its \(height\,mod\,1024 = 0\).
Parameters for the initial moment of time~\((height = 1)\) are hardcoded.

sections.heading: How to Propose and Vote for Changes#
sections.content:
To propose a change, a miner includes the vote identifier in the first block's header of a voting epoch. The header has three slots: two for everyday changes and one for soft forks. A zero should be set in any unoccupied slot. Votes can be arranged in any sequence.
For example, if a miner proposes to increase the storage fee factor and also initiate a soft-fork, they would input (0, 1, 120) in the header slots.
